ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Worrying, nervousness or anxiety
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Sleep disturbance for at least one week
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Bodily restlessness, e.g. pacing up and down, not being able to sit still
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Difficulty in coping with stress related to ordinary daily events for at least one week
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Difficulties thinking clearly or concentrating, interfering thoughts or thoughts interrupted
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Difficulties in considering alternatives or making even minor decisions
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Experience of thoughts running wild or difficulty in controlling thoughts
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Difficulties in understanding written text or speech heard
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Depression, apathy, loss of energy or marked tiredness
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Difficulty in controlling your speech, behavior or facial expressions
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Difficulty or uncertainty in making contact with other people for at least one week
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Lack of initiative or difficulty in completing tasks for at least one week
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Social withdrawal, e.g. avoiding company, feeling better in solitude
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Feelings that events in the surroundings or other people's behavior particularly concern you
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Feeling euphoric or especially competent and important
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Disorders of vision, e.g. blurred vision, visual oversensitivity or changing visual perceptions
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Disorders of hearing, e.g. oversensitivity, hearing odd sounds or hearing voices without obvious source
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Difficulties in carrying out ordinary routine activities like washing, dressing, homework, shopping, cycling, driving etc. for at least one week
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: A feeling that something strange or inexplicable is taking place in you or in your surroundings
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Thoughts, ideas or behaviors that are strange or unusual
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: A feeling that you are being followed or influenced in some special way
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: PROD-Screen Summary score
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
